posts.cooked: Is there a reason why we can only choose shades of white for the avatar backgrounds? Also people without avatar now all look almost the same as the distinct difference is now only the smallest part of the circle namely the two initials. I am not sure if I am happy that new versions keep reducing accessibility for me

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 5.18 release

posts.name: Masqueey
posts.cooked:
I just want to say that I really like the new colours! It took a few seconds to adjust to their new brightness, but it is really well done!

I also like how the chat opening animation is coloured into the same colour as the chat and that auto colouring works the way it used to work again. And the alternative profile pictures are just the absolute cutest!

As you might be able to tell, I’m really happy with this update, thank you for putting in all the hard work!

Not a fan of the pastel colors for the default initial avatars. Maybe all users should have a randomly assigned picture avatar, and they can change it if they want to? That would definitely encourage more people to set a custom avatar. The pastels also stand out funny in dark mode.

A bit of feedback on the new avatar color scheme, after some getting used to, it looks good with white theme,
but the new avatar color scheme doesn’t really work with dark mode, especially at night, there should probably be a different color scheme for dark mode, something less distracting.

Hold on, what’s going on here? I don’t see a single one of these on my device. Where does one get these from and on a related note, I’m really loving the art style in these so is there somewhere one can more of these from? I don’t mind commissioning it if someone can point me towards the artist.

posts.name: Alex Hart
posts.cooked:
All of the images were done by one of our designers

Do you have the latest beta installed? The screenshot shared is for group conversations.

Ah, I was only checking for my personal avatar.
Could you tell them they’ve done a wondrous job?
And is there anything at all one can do to get a giraffe added? Anything at all?

posts.name: Navneet Vikram Tey
posts.cooked:
Hi thanks for this 5.18 update, This has made group icon selection much better. Only issue? Limitation

Some of it kind of represent the other thing

Screenshot_20210724-002247_Signal (1)1080×2340 237 KB

This is very good implementation and kudos to Signal Team for doing it, I would just suggest more Icons to represent plethora of group, I know it’s never enough.

And the Irony is we can’t assign something “techy” to our techy-ish group :"(

Seeing the picture of teynav (above) with the sticker as avatar.

Is there actual the possibility to select a sticker directly as avatar? Is that still to come?

image

Screenshot_16270709531080×1920 185 KB
Bright pastel colored avatar backgrounds clash with Dark Mode style.

I am a dark theme user. Today the Android app updated to 5.18.5 and one change I noticed right away is that the avatar circles (the ones without pictures) are now much lighter because this was done to make the light theme look better and now they glare out more with the dark theme which has a pure black background.

The solution as I see it is to develop light and dark in parallel not make changes for light and have dark inherit them by default. A dark theme should not have lighter color bubbles. The previous version had darker colors for the avatar circles which was more appropriate for a dark theme.

A compromise might be to have a “dim” theme like twitter has as one of its options, then there wouldn’t be quite so much contrast between pure black and and the new lighter circles.

posts.name: Froiz
posts.cooked: Maybe there’s an issue with the Dinossaur avatar. I set it, and I received a bunch of messages about my new avatar because it looks like a d***. Maybe is intended.

posts.name: ch4tterb0x
posts.cooked:
Should it be possible to choose a custom color for the background of avatars?

If not, why not?

Yes it’s possible as described here.

Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 5.17 release iOS Beta Feedback
You can change the background color for the default images like the ghost. Tap on it a second time once the “pencil” icon is present.

Am I missing something?

Sorry if this wasn’t clear.

chatterbox:

Should it be possible to choose a custom color for the background of avatars?

If not, why not?

Not as of now,; idk

Maybe because

You can’t select the foreground color, so background could clash

The new avatar background options look out of place in dark mode, and they are all very similar. I suppose that’s because the intention is for the main difference to be the text color, but if you are using emoji as your “text” then you really don’t have a lot of background options.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
To clarify the nature of this topic: to organize the feedback about this change (lighter default avatars + avatar editor with text or new default images as options) a little bit, I’ve merged posts about it into a single topic. That is why some posts above aren’t exactly in chronological order.

Some feedback can’t be merged as easily because the posts are not entirely about the change itself. These posts are listed below for completeness:

  • Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 5.17 release - #8 by M00nD3v
  • Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 5.17 release - #12 by MindlessDistance
  • Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 5.18 release - #16 by ponytail
  • Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 5.18 release - #59 by Signal.DE
  • Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 5.18 release - #176 by p4nci
anon61006462:

there should probably be a different color scheme for dark mode, something less distracting

Sunspark:

A dark theme should not have lighter color bubbles. The previous version had darker colors for the avatar circles which was more appropriate for a dark theme.

Having a separate “dark” variant would indeed work for the default avatars, which are automatically generated on the device.

The slight issue, however, is that, for the avatars that the user sets (for their profile and for groups), if they use the avatar creator/editor for making an avatar with a default graphic or with text, it would currently just set it as an image, as explained in the following post:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 5.18 release Android Beta Feedback
This is impossible (or at least not practical). When you save the icon, we convert it into a jpeg that can be uploaded. Nothing outside of the avatar picker sees your selection as a vector and background color, it sees an image. When you enter the screen again and we grab your “current” avatar, we see an image and thus no selection is made. We could render a jpeg of each preview and compare it to the one you’ve set, but this is going to have a lot of false negatives and be super CPU intensive …

So users may be confused why some default avatars correctly appear according to their theme, while other “default” ones (which really are regular profile pictures set by the user) do not (even more so if they are “text” avatars just like the “real” default avatars).

Solving this “slight issue” would likely require storing the “color” and “text / image option” separately as part of the user’s Signal Profile, which has some challenges such as:

  • Compatibility with older Signal versions (temporary);
  • Ensuring users do not have their avatar unexpectedly change (if the default ones are ever changed, removed, or new ones are added or if the color palette/selections are changed).

posts.cooked:
awaitlink:

The slight issue, however, is that, for the avatars that the user sets (for their profile and for groups), if they use the avatar creator/editor for making an avatar with a default graphic or with text, it would currently just set it as an image, as explained in the following post:

Yep, this all makes sense.

so considering I don’t really think we need this feature,

maybe drop the ability to change the background color, keep the text and the sticker like avatars, (perhaps add some more that work better with dark mode for people to choose)

and give the option of changing the text color instead of the background, let the background be determined automatically depending on the displaying client’s color theme.

it would require some predefined text colors that work on both dark and light backgrounds.

it’s just a two minute thought… feel free to pick it apart

I should probably just open a feature request for users to have the in-app option of setting their own avatars for their contacts, without using the picture in Android’s contacts app.

if there isn’t such a request already.

The contrast between the black background of dark theme is too much for me. It’s better in the light theme, but the letters and backgrounds are harder to tell apart at a glance than the old way in either theme.

It probably doesn’t matter much for people with lots of contacts that have chosen avatars, but only about 5 of my 30 or so Signal contacts have set one (to say nothing of all the SMS only contacts who can’t), so my conversation list is just a sea of bright but difficult to distinguish icons.

Of course, what I really want is to match the icon color to the chat color, but associating people with particular colors is naughty.

I’m at the point where I’m just going to set images for all my contacts so I can get something decent. But those don’t sync with the desktop version, do they? Is there any way to change them there?
